item.description:
Nathaniel Branden's Conceptualization of Self-Esteem:
Why It Is Important -- and Two Simple Questions the Asking of Which Have Direct & Immediate Self-Esteem Boosting Effects

Mark Shar, a BON founding member and long-time BON participant and fan of Ayn Rand's works, will present his thoughts & ideas about Nathaniel Branden's conceptualization of self-esteem and why it is important.

Questions that will be addressed include:
- What is self-esteem?
- How does Rand's definition differ from Branden's?
- Are there things/people external to self that can increase or decrease one's self-esteem?
- Why understanding this concept -- and especially Branden's conceptualization of it -- is vital to your psychological health and, in particular, your happiness & success, your felt enjoyment and level of satisfaction in life.
- What are the actions or practices that enhance self-esteem?
- What are two simple questions you can ask yourself, day in and day out, about anything and everything in your life that will, in the asking have a direct and immediate positive impact on your self-esteem, your happiness and your level of satisfaction in life?

group.name: The Boston Ayn Rand Meetup Group
